</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Almadex compensates the Company 30% of the Company's actual monthly cost of rent for any shared facilities, and 30% of any shared personnel's fees and/or wages.&#160; Almadex pays the Company any reasonable fees or costs incurred on behalf of Almadex by the Company which were approved by Almadex.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Agreement has an initial 5-year term, with subsequent automatic 1 year renewals unless terminated pursuant to the terms permitted under the Agreement.&#160; The Agreement includes
</FONT>
	a Change of Control clause.&#160; If either party is subject to a Change of Control during the term of the Agreement, the Agreement shall automatically terminate within 48 hours of the Change of Control unless agreed to in writing by both parties.&#160; The target of the Change of Control shall then pay the other party $2 million as compensation for the unplanned termination of the Company's engagement and significant disruption to the other party's business.&#160; "Change of Control" means the date upon which, without the written concurrence of the target of the Change of Control, any person (as that term is defined in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Securities Act
</FONT>
	(British Columbia)) makes and does not withdraw a take-over bid (as that term is defined in the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Securities Act
</FONT>
	(British Columbia)) or acquires, directly or indirectly, that number of common shares of the target which equals or exceeds twenty percent (20%) of the then issued common shares of the target.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	24
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Business Overview
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Maintaining properties
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following is a general statement about government requirements for holding mineral properties in the jurisdictions where the Company currently holds material mineral property interests.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In Mexico, mining law is a federal matter.&#160; The government requires annual assessment work and expenditures per hectare which increase with the size and age of the claim.&#160; Under the tax reforms effective January 1, 2014, if a concession holder has not conducted exploration or exploitation activities during a two-year period, the concession holder would have to pay an additional 50% of the taxes payable per hectare if within the last 11 years, and an additional 100% of the taxes payable if after year 12.&#160; Land taxes per hectare also have to be paid by January 31 and July 31 each year.&#160; Both amounts are subject to inflation accounting and the inflation adjustment number for each fiscal period is published in the official gazette.&#160; Under the Mexican Constitution and the mining and environmental laws of Mexico, all mining projects are subject to Federal legal control.&#160; This control is exercised from the exploration phase through the closure phase of a mining project.&#160; Prior to the initiation of exploration activities, concession owners are required to file a notice of commencement of exploration activities in conformity with Mexican Official Norm 120 (NOM-120); prior to initiation of construction activities (and also in some more intrusive exploration activities), mining projects are required to apply for and obtain an environmental impact authorization and a land use permit from the Mexican Federal environmental agency SEMARNAT (Secretaria de Medio Ambiente y Recursos Naturales).&#160; This requires the presentation of an environmental impact manifest and a technical study which deals with the impacts, the environmental mitigation, and habitat compensation to the satisfaction of the authorities having environmental jurisdiction.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Competition
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The mineral property exploration and development business, in general, is intensively competitive and there is not any assurance that even if commercial quantities of ore are discovered, a ready market will exist for sale of same. Numerous factors beyond our control may affect the marketability of any substances discovered.&#160; These factors include market fluctuations; the proximity and capacity of natural resource markets and processing equipment; and government regulations, including regulations relating to prices, taxes, royalties, land tenure, land use, importing and exporting of mineral and environmental protection.&#160; The exact effect of these factors cannot be accurately predicted, but the combination of these factors may make it difficult for us to receive an adequate return on investment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	We compete with many companies possessing greater financial resources and technical facilities for the acquisition of mineral concessions, claims, leases and other mineral interests as well as for the recruitment and retention of qualified employees.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Seasonality
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company's principal project is in central Mexico.&#160; In Mexico, the climate in the project area is marked by dry, cold winters and a distinct rainy season.&#160; The rainy season typically begins in May or June and continues until late September to October.&#160; In most years roads remain passable and exploration can be done throughout the rainy season.&#160; Seasonal changes do not have a material impact on our exploration expenditures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<U>
	Exploration Program Protocols
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.4PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	General Sample Handling and Quality Control Program for Exploration Programs
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company employs a strict quality control program for samples taken during its exploration programs.&#160; For drilling programs a quality control program is in place which includes the insertion of blanks, field duplicates and certified standards into the sample stream.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Chain of Custody
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Samples of rock and drill core and cuttings are sealed by the sampler and kept under control of a qualified person until they are shipped to a laboratory.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	25
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sample Handling
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sample handling for drilling programs is described more fully below. Soil and stream sediment samplers have been trained to industry standard levels of sampling methodology.&#160; In general, the Company sieves stream sediment samples to -20 mesh in the field during preparation.&#160; Samplers are required to not wear any jewellery or clothing or use equipment which may contaminate the sample.&#160; All sample locations are geographically located at the time of sampling using the Global Positioning System.&#160; The Company has prepared standardized sample information cards for samplers to record information concerning the sample location, type and medium. Outcrop, float and dump rock samples are collected by geologists who record similarly ordered geologic information relating to the sample taken.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Blanks
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Blank material, a sample of crushed and pulverized rock, known to contain very low or non-detectable concentration of gold, is inserted as a pulp into the sample stream on an interval of every 20 samples.&#160; Blanks are intended to detect possible contamination.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Duplicates
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During drill programs the Company routinely includes a field duplicate into the sample stream, spaced at 20 sample intervals.&#160; Field duplicate samples are splits of drill core or reverse circulation cuttings from the sample interval.&#160; The resulting two field duplicate samples are submitted with separate sample numbers "blind" to the assay lab and separately treated as normal samples.&#160; The samples are taken randomly with no regard to rock type, geographic position or degree of alteration or mineralization.&#160; These field duplicates are then used to detect the cumulative uncertainties associated with the entire sampling and analytical process.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Standards
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During drill programs the Company routinely includes a field duplicate into the sample stream, spaced at 20 sample intervals.&#160; Certified standards are purchased from CDN Resource Labs of Vancouver and are prepared by this professional third party lab according to industry standard and accepted methodologies.&#160; Standards are utilized to monitor the accuracy of the laboratory work.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sample Handling for Drill Programs
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Core Box Preparation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Plastic core boxes are used for the storage of core.&#160; Each box is labelled by the drillers at the rig with the drill-hole number, a box number and an arrow to mark the start of the tray and the down-hole direction.&#160; Wooden core blocks, with the meterage in black marker pen, are inserted by the drillers at the end of each core run (usually 3 m or less).&#160; These core run intervals are checked and recorded by the geologist during mark up (see below).&#160; When filled with core the boxes are sealed with a plastic lid by the drillers and transported to the core logging facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sample and Corebox Markup
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Once at the core logging facility, the core boxes are marked up with the starting and ending meterage, written at the ends of the trays with a marker.&#160; An aluminum tag with the hole number, box number and meterage is then stapled to the front of each tray.&#160; The core blocks are then covered with an aluminum permi-tag with the depth inscribed and written over in black marker pen for clarity in core tray photographs.&#160; The start and end of each selected sample interval is marked with a red wax pencil mark across the core and sample numbers are written on the edge of the core box channels at the start and end of each sample interval.&#160; Intervals denoting the position in the sample tag sequence of field duplicate, blank and analytical standards are also marked on the core box.&#160; Different colored tape was stapled to the boxes to indicate the position and type of duplicate sample.&#160; A permanent aluminum tag with the sample number inscribed on them was stapled to the inside of the core box channel at the start of each sample interval.&#160; A cut line was marked on the core as a guide for sawing of half-core samples for assay.&#160; The cut line position is marked by fitting the ends of the core together, to align them as they came out of the hole, and using a ruler to draw a line down the core axis with a red wax pencil.&#160; This mark-up is done after the trays are photographed.&#160; Cut line positions are selected by the logging geologist to produce two halves with equal proportions of mineralization.&#160; Typically this is done by marking the cut line down the long axis of the ellipses described by the intersection of the veins with the core circumference.&#160; Each tray is digitally photographed before core cutting and sampling.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	26
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Core Logging
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Before cutting and sampling the core, the following tables of data are recorded on paper and then entered into the Company drill hole database system:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Geotechnical Logging
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1. Core box record sheet:&#160; Beginning and end from/to intervals for each core box.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2. For each core run (from and to) a record of the core size, meters of core recovered for the interval, RQD (the total length of pieces of core in the interval that are twice the width of the core divided by the length of the interval, times 100) and hardness (on a scale from 1 to 5, from softest to hardest).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3. A drilling daily control sheet showing the progress of the rig for each shift.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Geological Logging
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	1. Geology Log:&#160; Intervals selected by the geologist recording a detailed description of the lithology, texture, alteration, mineral assemblage and intensity and level of oxidation/weathering.&#160; Structural measurements (i.e. the angle of structures to the core axis) are also recorded.&#160; The cover sheet includes details such as surveyed collar co-ordinates, downhole survey data, core size depths, drilling dates and sample number series.&#160; A graphic log column with a sketch of the geology is also included.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	2. Veining and Mineralization:&#160; (Intervals on this form are the same as the sample intervals).&#160; Estimates of the percent veining and the percentage of different minerals represented in either vein, breccia or disseminated form, i.e. quartz, carbonates, pyrite etc. (sometimes completed after sampling).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	3. Sample Sheet:&#160; A record of the sample intervals, sample numbers and duplicate, blank and analytical standard numbers as well as magnetic susceptibility measurements taken on each sample (using a handheld magnetic susceptibility meter pushed against the core).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	4. Hole Summary: An abbreviated hole log that summarizes the important features of a drill hole.&#160; A summary drill hole trace giving the geologist the opportunity to summarize the hole and sketch in structural orientations in a form easily transferred to sections.&#160; All logs are saved on the server along with the core photos and other data from each hole.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sample Interval Selection
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	All strongly altered or mineralized intervals of core were sampled.&#160; Sampling always began at least 5 samples above the start of mineralization.&#160; Sample intervals were selected using the following criteria.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.4PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="CBA8711CE057478EB5312C68AF5C0142" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Maximum sample length of 2 m in unmineralized lithologies.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="98F0860BE30D49C49E1E4626694DBB48" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Maximum sample length of 1 m in mineralized lithologies.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="9CF6A83E5B564D6E9E9DEE7F9119EFFD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Minimum sample length of 50 cm. Geological changes in the core such as major mineralization/alteration intensity and lithology changes were used as sample breaks.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="5E8787628F464C6AA8D40F2C22B67EFB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Core size changes and any zones of core loss were used as sample breaks.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="9C35F3896D7E4005A920E49895D5E967" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Large discrete veins that might possibly be modeled or mined as separate structures were sampled separately.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.4PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The begin/end marks were placed so that the entire vein ended up in the sample(s) and the vein is not smeared into samples on either side.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sampling Procedure
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	All samples were originally cut in half using custom-made, gasoline engine-powered diamond core saws.&#160; All were recently changed to electric powered saws.&#160; Each saw has sliding trays and customized "core cradles" sized for each core diameter in order to ensure a straight cut down the cut line and to minimize the loss of friable core during cutting. Areas of very soft rock (e.g. fault gouge), are cut with a machete, using the side of the core channel to ensure a straight cut.&#160; Areas of very broken core (pieces &lt;1 cm) were sampled using spoons.&#160; The following standard sampling procedures were employed:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	27
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage28"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The right hand side of the core (looking down the hole) was always sampled.&#160; After cutting, half the core was placed in a new plastic sample bag and half was placed back in the core box.&#160; Between each sample, the core saw and sampling table areas were washed to ensure no contamination between samples.&#160; Field duplicate, blank and analytical standards were added into the sample sequence as they were being cut.&#160; After cutting of samples containing visible gold, a piece of abrasive quartz sandstone was cut to clean the diamond blade.&#160; This was done to prevent contamination of the following sample with gold that may have become smeared onto the blade.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sample numbers were written on the outside of the sample bags twice and the tag from the sample book was placed inside the bag with the half core.&#160; The bags were sealed using single-use plastic cable ties.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Sample numbers on the bags were checked against the numbers on the core box and the sample book.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The core cutting area is within the core logging shed and the logging geologists regularly checked the precision of the core cutting and sampling.&#160; The sealed plastic sample bags were placed in large plastic twine (rice) sacks (usually between 8 and 10 samples per sack) and sealed using single-use plastic cable ties.&#160; The sacks were weighed and the sack number, sample numbers, sack weight and date written on the outside of the sacks.
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Company's Principal Properties
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Tuligtic Project, which hosts the Company's Ixtaca discovery, is the only project material to the Company. The Tuligtic Project is located in Puebla State, Mexico.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	PRINCIPAL PROPERTY INTERESTS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	The Tuligtic Property/Project &#8211; Mexico
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Location and Access
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Ixtaca deposit, the epithermal gold-silver target within the Tuligtic Property, is located 8 km northwest of the town of San Francisco Ixtacamaxtitl&#225;n, the county seat of the municipality of Ixtacamaxtitl&#225;n, Puebla State.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The project is accessible by driving 40 km east along Highway 119 from Apizaco, an industrial center located approximately 50 km north of Puebla City by two-lane Highway, and then north approximately 2 km along a paved road to the town of Santa Maria.&#160; The trip from Apizaco to site can be driven in approximately 1.5 hours. There is also access to the Property using gravel roads from the northeast via Tezhuitan and Cuyoaco, from the south via Libres and from the northwest via Chignahuapan.&#160; The X
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	icohtencatl Industrial complex lies 30 km southwest by paved road from the Tuligtic Project, and houses agricultural, chemical, biomedical and industrial manufacturing facilities and is serviced by rail.&#160; Puebla, the fourth largest city in Mexico has a population in excess of 4 million people, and includes one of the largest Volkswagen automotive plants outside Germany.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The
</FONT>
	Topography on the Tuligtic Project is generally moderate to steep hills with incised stream drainages. Elevation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	ranges from 2,300 meters (m) above sea level in the south to 2,800 m in the north.&#160; Vegetation is dominantly cactus and pines and the general area is also somewhat cultivated with subsistence vegetables, bean and corn crops.&#160; The Ixtaca Zone exploration area has been previously cleared and logged.&#160; The region has a temperate climate with average temperatures ranging from 19&#176;C in June to 10&#176;C in December.&#160; The area experiences about 600 mm of precipitation annually with the majority falling during the rainy season, between June and September.&#160; Exploration can be conducted year round within the Property.&#160; Electricity is available on the Property as the national electricity grid services nearby towns such as Santa Maria and Zacatepec.&#160; Water for exploration is available from year-round natural springs located at higher elevations above and upstream of the Ixtaca deposit.&#160; The surface rights locally are privately owned and where Almaden is exploring the Company has negotiated surface land use agreements with surface rights landowners.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	28
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<IMG STYLE="WIDTH: 601PX; HEIGHT: 843PX" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/31/0001102624-16-002439_IMAGE0.JPG">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	29
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">

<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7PT">

</DIV>
</DIV>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_5"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Claims and Title
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Tuligtic property consists of three claims held 100% by Minera Gorrion S.A. de C.V., a subsidiary of Almaden Minerals Ltd. through the holding company, Puebla Holdings Inc.&#160; The claims, tabularized below, cover an area of over 14,000 hectares and were staked.&#160; Almaden acquired the claims in 2001, following the identification of surficial clay deposits that were interpreted to represent high-level epithermal alteration.&#160; Official title documents have been issued for all claims, the details of which are summarized below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="221F6E749C484E8D936177D7F1778018" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">

	Total
</DIV>

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 12.7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	14,229.55
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; WIDTH: 33.33%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During 2015, Almaden filed an application to reduce the aggregate claim size at Tuligtic to manage its land position outside the main discovery zone and in consideration of regional exploration studies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Geological Setting of the Tuligtic Project and Ixtaca Zone
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Within the Tuligtic Project, argillaceous limestone of the Late Jurassic to Early Cretaceous Upper Tamaulipas formation is underlain by transitional calcareous clastic rocks including siltstone, grainstone, mudstone, and calcareous shale.&#160; During the Laramide orogeny the carbonate package was intensely deformed into a series of thrust-related east verging anticlines.&#160; Calcareous shale units appear to occupy the cores of the anticlines while the thick bedded limestone/mudstone units occupy the cores of major synclines at the Ixtaca Zone.&#160; These carbonate basement units are crosscut by intensely altered intermediate composition dykes in the Tertiary.&#160; The deformed Mesozoic sedimentary sequence is discordantly overlain by epithermal altered Cenozoic bedded crystal tuff of the upper Coyoltepec subunit.&#160; The Coyoltepec volcanics are locally oxidized and weathered near surface and along structures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Two styles of alteration and mineralization have been identified in the area: (1) copper-molybdenum porphyry style alteration and mineralization hosted by diorite and quartz-diorite intrusions; (2) silver-gold low-sulphidation epithermal quartz-bladed calcite veins hosted primarily by carbonate rocks and spatially associated with overlying volcanic hosted texturally destructive clay alteration and replacement silicification.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Outcropping porphyry-style alteration and mineralization is observed in the bottoms of several drainages where the altered intrusive complex is exposed in erosional windows beneath post mineral unconsolidated ash deposits.&#160; Multiple late and post mineral intrusive phases have been identified crossing an early intensely altered and quartz-veined medium-grained feldspar phyric diorite named the Principal Porphyry.&#160; Other intrusive types include late and post mineral mafic dykes and an inter-mineral feldspar-quartz phyric diorite.&#160; Late mineral mafic dykes are fine grained and altered to chlorite with accessory pyrite.&#160; Calc-silicate (garnet-clinopyroxene) altered limestone occurs in proximity to the intrusive contacts and is crosscut by late quartz-pyrite veins.&#160; Early biotite alteration of the principal porphyry consists of biotite-orthoclase flooding of the groundmass.&#160; Quartz veins associated with early alteration have irregular boundaries and are interpreted to be representative of A-style porphyry veins.&#160; These are followed by molybdenite veins which are associated with the same wall rock alteration.&#160; Chalcopyrite appears late in the early alteration sequence. Late alteration is characterized by intense zones of muscovite-illite-pyrite overprinting earlier quartz-K-feldspar-pyrite &#177; chalcopyrite veining and replacing earlier hydrothermal orthoclase and biotite.&#160; Stockwork quartz-pyrite crosscuts the A-style veins and is associated with muscovite-illite alteration of biotite.&#160; The quartz-sericite alteration can be texturally destructive resulting in white friable quartz veined and pyrite rich rock.&#160; Pyrite is observed replacing chalcopyrite and in some instances chalcopyrite remains only as inclusions within late stage pyrite grains.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Epithermal mineralization on the Tuligtic property is considered to have no genetic relationship to the porphyry alteration and mineralization described above.&#160; The epithermal system is unoxidised and well preserved, and there is evidence of a paleosurface as steam heated kaolinite and replacement silica alteration occur at higher elevations where the upper part of the Coyoltepec pyroclastic deposit is preserved.&#160; The veining of Ixtaca epithermal system displays characteristics representative of intermediate and low sulphidation deposits.&#160; These include typical ore and gangue mineralogy (electrum, sphalerite, galena, adularia, carbonates), mineralization dominantly in open space veins (colloform banding, cavity filling).
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	30
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mineralized hydrothermal breccias showing multiphase development are commonly encountered within the main veins. Hydrothermal silicic/carbonate breccia zones occur within the limestone and dip steeply.&#160; These breccias are dominantly controlled by the main faults.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Upper Tamaulipas formation, the dykes that crosscut it and the upper Coyoltepec volcanic subunit are the main host rocks to the epithermal vein system at Ixtaca.&#160; In the Main and Ixtaca North zones veining strikes dominantly ENE-WNW (060 degrees) parallel to a major dyke trend and at a very high angle to the N to NNW bedding and fold structures within the limestones.&#160; The veins of the Chemalaco Zone are hosted by the shaley carbonate units and strike to the NNW, dipping to the SSW. In the footwall to Chemalaco Zone a parallel dyke has been identified which is altered and mineralized.&#160; The Chemalaco Zone and the dyke are interpreted to strike parallel to bedding and to core an antiform comprised of calcareous shale.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Studies of mineral assemblages in hand specimen, transmitted and reflected light microscopy and SEM analyses were carried out in order to construct a paragenetic sequence of mineral formation.&#160; This work revealed that veining occurred in three main stages.&#160; The first stage is barren calcite veining.&#160; This is followed by buff brown and pink colloform carbonate and silicate veins containing abundant silver minerals and lower gold.&#160; The third stage of veining contains both gold and silver mineralization.&#160; The dominant gold-bearing mineral is electrum, with varying Au:Ag ratios.&#160; The majority of grains contain 40-60 wt (weight) % gold but a few have down to 20 wt% (Staffurth, 2012).&#160; Gold content occasionally varies within electrum grains, and some larger grains seem to be composed of aggregates of several smaller grains of differing composition (Staffurth, 2012).&#160; Electrum often appears to have been deposited with late galena-clausthalite both of which are found as inclusions or in fractures in pyrite. It is also closely associated with silver minerals such as uytenbogaardtite (Ag
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	3
</SUB>
	AuS
<SUB STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; FONT-SIZE: SMALLER">
	2
</SUB>
	).&#160; This mineral is associated with electrum, chalcopyrite, galena, alabandite, silver minerals and quartz in stage three mineralization.&#160; Apart from electrum, the dominant silver bearing minerals are polybasite (-pearceite) and argentian tetrahedrite plus minor acanthite-naumannite, pyrargyrite and stephanite.&#160; They are associated with sulphides or are isolated in gangue minerals.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The vein-related mineralization at Ixtaca does not have hard geologic boundaries.&#160; The mineralized zones are essentially vein zones, the outer boundaries of which are grade boundaries associated with decreased vein density.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	History of Past Work
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	To the Company's knowledge, no modern exploration was carried out on the project prior to Almaden's acquisition of the property area by staking in 2001.&#160; Evidence of historic mining of clay (kaolinite) deposits from surface is evident throughout the property area.&#160; Almaden acquired the Cerro Grande claims of the Tuligtic Project in 2001 following the identification of surficial clay deposits that were interpreted to represent high-level epithermal alteration.&#160; In 2010, the Company acquired the third Caldera 3-a claim, which has subsequently been dropped.&#160; Subsequent geologic mapping, rock, stream silt, soil sampling and induced polarization (IP) geophysical surveys identified porphyry copper and epithermal gold targets within an approximately 5 x 5 km area of intensely altered rock.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On May 9, 2002 Almaden entered into a joint venture agreement with BHP Billiton World Exploration Inc. (BHP) to undertake exploration in eastern Mexico. Initial helicopter-borne reconnaissance programs were completed in May 2003 and March 2004 on select targets within the joint venture area of interest. The work resulted in the acquisition of five (5) separate properties, in addition to the previously acquired Cerro Grande of the present day Tuligtic Property. Following a review of the initial exploration data, effective January 20, 2005, BHP relinquished its interest in the six properties to Almaden. The joint venture was terminated in 2006.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Later in 2006, the Tuligtic project was optioned to Pinnacle Mines Ltd.&#160; In 2007 this option agreement was terminated.&#160; In 2009 the property was optioned to Antofagasta Minerals S.A. under terms whereby it could earn a 75% interest in the property. In 2009 and 2010 Antofagasta Minerals S.A., under Almaden operation, conducted a geophysical and exploration drilling program on the copper porphyry area of the project. The program consisted of three lines of IP geophysics and 2,522 meters of diamond drilling in six holes.&#160; The IP chargeability results, along with that of previous programs carried out by Almaden, defined a 2 by 2.5 kilometer chargeability high the limits of which are currently only defined to the west and south. The drilling intersected skarn and porphyry copper-molybdenum mineralization in an intrusive complex. Four of the six drill holes were oriented within thirty degrees of north south and located within a 200 by 300 meter area roughly in the central portion of the IP chargeability anomaly. These holes were selected based on intensely altered and quartz-veined porphyry exposed in the drainages in the central portion of the chargeability anomaly. The drilling program encountered sub economic porphyry mineralization. The mineralized intersections, despite being largely in skarn and uneconomic, are considered by the Company to be encouraging for the greater porphyry potential of the system. Antofagasta Minerals S.A. terminated its option on the project in March 2010.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	31
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In July 2010 Almaden initiated a diamond drilling program on the gold-silver epithermal vein target area of the project located roughly 1 kilometer to the south of the porphyry prospect on the project. The first hole in this program (results announced in August, 2010) intersected a zone of banded carbonate-quartz epithermal veining with gold and silver values. This hole constitutes the discovery of the Ixtaca Zone of veining. The entire hole cut through a vein zone of varying intensity of veining and intersected 302.41m of 1.01 g/t Au &amp; 48 g/t Ag. Within this broad zone of veining several higher grade veins were intersected including 44.35 meters of 2.77 g/t Au and 117.7 g/t Ag.&#160; Immediately after this discovery the Company initiated a follow-up drill program.&#160; Between 2010 and 2013, Almaden's exploration at the Ixtaca Zone of the Tuligtic Property included geologic mapping and prospecting, alteration mineralogic characterization, rock and soil geochemical sampling, ground magnetics, IP and resistivity, Controlled Source Audio-frequency Magnetotelluric (CSAMT), and Controlled Source Induced Polarization (CSIP) geophysical surveys resulting in the identification of several anomalous zones.&#160; Since 2010, a total of 453 exploration diamond drill holes have been drilled at the Tuligtic Gold-Silver Project, totaling 147,892 m.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Present Condition of Project and 2014 Exploration Program
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Geology and Mineral Resources
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Ixtaca deposit is an epithermal gold-silver deposit, mostly hosted by veins in carbonate units (calcareous clastic rocks) and crosscutting pre-mineral altered dykes ("basement rocks") with a minor component of disseminated mineralisation hosted in overlying volcanic rocks.&#160; Wireframes constraining mineralised domains were constructed based on geologic boundaries defined by mineralisation intensity and host rock type.&#160; Higher grade zones occur where there is a greater density of epithermal veining. These higher grade domains have good continuity and are cohesive in nature.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On January 31, 2013, the Company announced a maiden resource on the Ixtaca Zone.&#160; Since that time drilling has been focused on expanding and infilling the known resource base for the PEA which utilised the NI 43-101 Compliant Updated Mineral Resource Estimate released January 22, 2014, performed by Gary Giroux, P.Eng., qualified person under the meaning of NI 43-101, and summarised in Table 1 below.&#160; The data available for the resource estimation consisted of 423 drill holes assayed for gold and silver.&#160; The estimate was constrained by three dimensional solids representing different lithologic and mineralized domains.&#160; Of the total drill holes 400 intersected the mineralized solids and were used to make the resource estimate.&#160; Capping was completed to reduce the effect of outliers within each domain.&#160; Uniform down hole 3 meter composites were produced for each domain and used to produce semi-variograms for each variable.&#160; Grades were interpolated into blocks 10 x 10 x 5 meters in dimension by ordinary kriging.&#160; Specific gravities were determined for each domain from drill core.&#160; Estimated blocks were classified as either Measured, Indicated or Inferred based on drill hole density and grade continuity.
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	32
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEHEADER">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.7PT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Cautionary Note to U.S. Investors concerning estimates of Measured and Indicated Resources
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 49.5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 49.5PT">
	This section uses the terms "measured resources" and "indicated resources".&#160; We advise U.S. investors that while these terms are recognized and required by Canadian regulations, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission does not recognize them.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	U.S. Investors are cautioned not to assume that any part or all of mineral deposits in these categories will ever be converted into reserves.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 49.5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-RIGHT: 49.5PT">
	Cautionary Note to U.S. Investors concerning estimates of Inferred
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 49.5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; MARGIN-RIGHT: 49.5PT">
	Resources
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-LEFT: 49.5PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 49.5PT">
	This section uses the term "inferred resources". We advise U.S. investors that while this term is recognized and required by Canadian regulations, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission does not recognize it. "Inferred resources" have a great amount of uncertainty as to their existence, and great uncertainty as to their economic and legal feasibility. It cannot be assumed that all or any part of an Inferred Mineral Resource will ever be upgraded to a higher category. Under Canadian rules, estimates of Inferred Mineral Resources may not form the basis of feasibility or other economic studies.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	U.S. investors are cautioned not to assume that part or all of an inferred resource exists, or is economically or legally mineable
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<IMG STYLE="WIDTH: 473PX; HEIGHT: 419PX" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/03/31/0001102624-16-002439_IMAGE1.JPG">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 8PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 7PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Table 1: Ixtaca Zone NI 43-101 Measured, Indicated and Inferred Mineral Resource Statement with the Base Case 0.5 g/t AuEq Cut-Off highlighted.&#160; Also shown are the 0.3, 0.7, 1.0 and 2.0 g/t AuEq cut-off results. AuEq calculation based on three year trailing average prices of $1540/oz gold and $30/oz silver.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	Preliminary Economic Assessments
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	December 2015 PEA
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On December 9, 2015, the Company announced the results of an optimized PEA which follows the historical PEA released in 2014 and amended on November 6, 2015 ("Historical PEA") which evaluated larger throughput development alternatives.&#160; The primary reasons for providing an update to the Historical PEA studies were to show the impact of significantly reduced initial capital cost on project economics and, given the significant decrease in precious metals prices, to demonstrate the viability of a mine plan which focuses on the near surface high grade limestone hosted portions of the Ixtaca Zone deposit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	33
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	This mine plan is a smaller high grade scenario that still allows for expansion into a larger production scenario similar to those described in Almaden's Historical PEA studies.&#160; In addition, the PEA incorporates the optioned Rock Creek mill as well as results from various engineering studies related to the project which had been conducted since the Historical PEA report. The PEA incorporates:

	This PEA is preliminary in nature as it includes inferred mineral resources which are considered too speculative geologically to have the economic considerations applied to them that would enable them to be categorized as mineral reserves.&#160; There is no certainty that the PEA forecasts will be realized or that any of the resources will ever be upgraded to reserves. Mineral Resources that are not Mineral Reserves do not have demonstrated economic viability.

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="BA830AF1F42B421F8E29146BF018051A" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Mine life of 13 years with an average processing rate of 7,500 tonnes per day;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="62475D990DE54BFEA88B83F47396755F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Average annual production of 55,660 ounces of gold and 3,754,000 ounces of silver;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="6C66B2B375604BFC8BC8DC6D1592B566" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Estimated pre-production capital of US$100M. Sustaining capital of US$24M;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="7E08702990734026A5B5BD379E2008CD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21.3PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	After-Tax Payback of initial capital of 2.6 years.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Production and Processing
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Ixtaca gold-silver project in the PEA is planned as an open pit mining operation using contractor mining. Estimated mining inventory is comprised of 179 million tonnes of rock and 36 million tonnes of mill feed with an average mill feed grade of 0.76 grams per tonne gold and 47 grams per tonne silver. A total of 724 thousand ounces of gold and 48.8 million ounces of silver would be produced over the 13 year mine life. The PEA includes the Rock Creek process plant to produce gold and silver dor&#233; on site. The process plant includes conventional crushing, grinding, gravity, flotation, and concentrate leaching. Process reagents will be removed from process plant tailings prior to placement in a tailings management facility ("TMF"). The following table summarizes the production and processing parameters:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH" ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEFOOTER">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: NORMAL; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL" ID="DSPFPAGENUMBER">
	34
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; MARGIN: 12PT 35.4PT 12PT 42.55PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	*
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	The mill feed tonnes in the mine plan include Inferred Resources.&#160; The reader is cautioned that Inferred Resources are considered too speculative geologically to have economic considerations applied to them that would enable them to be categorized as Mineral Reserves.&#160; There is no certainty that Inferred Resources will ever be upgraded to Reserves. Mineral Resources that are not Mineral Reserves do not have demonstrated economic viability.
</U>
</FONT>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; MARGIN: 12PT 35.4PT 12PT 42.55PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	** The cut-off grade used to calculate the mill feed is NSR&gt;=$20/t. NSR is calculated using the following formula: NSR = [Au(g/t) * Au recovery (%) * 36.55] + [Ag(g/t) * Ag recovery (%) * 0.46]
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: -7.1PT; MARGIN: 12PT 35.4PT 12PT 42.55PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	*** The strip ratio includes 13 million tonnes of stockpiled material not processed in this PEA that averages 0.31 g/t Au and 45 g/t Ag as waste. Should this material be processed the ultimate strip ratio would be 3:1.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Capital and Operating Costs
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The total estimated initial capital cost for the Ixtaca gold-silver project is US$100.2 million and sustaining capital is $24 million over the mine life ("LOM"). The estimated LOM operating costs are US$26.99 per tonne mill feed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following tables summarize the cost components:
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Economic Results and Sensitivities
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	A summary of financial outcomes comparing base case metal prices to two alternative metal price situations is presented below.&#160; The December 2015 PEA base case prices are derived from a combination of spot prices and current common peer usage. The Alternate Case prices represent a discount to the lowest sustained metal prices over the previous three years. The 3 year trailing average prices represent the upside potential should metal prices regain their previous strength.
</DIV>

	Summary of Ixtaca Gold-Silver Economic Results and Sensitivities (US$ Million)

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_9"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="E0840F00507B4A169523244663E21CA7" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT: 21PX">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 30.77%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2PX SOLID; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF; WIDTH: 23.07%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; BORDER-TOP: #000000 2PX SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: #000000 2PX SOLID" COLSPAN="2">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Alternate Case

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<U>
	The economic results are based on the mill feed tonnages in the selected ultimate pit.&#160; The mill feed tonnages include Inferred Resources.&#160; The reader is cautioned that Inferred Resources are considered too speculative geologically to have the economic considerations applied to them that would enable them to be categorized as Mineral Reserves.&#160; There is no certainty that Inferred Resources will ever be upgraded to Reserves. Mineral Resources that are not Mineral Reserves do not have demonstrated economic viability.
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Rock Management, Environment and Community
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Almaden recognises the paramount importance of protecting the environment to facilitate the development of a sustainable project. Knight Pi&#233;sold Ltd. ("KP") has been retained to help the Company with long lead item studies concerning environmental monitoring, assessment and permitting matters. Almaden established the following environmental objectives for the Project:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" ID="424714A9CE6A4A358B2005BC4B763616" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.15PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; WIDTH: AUTO; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	Protect surface and ground water quality;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
